result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A MacHovec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash applied to fine, paid in full.

Cash applied to costs, paid in full.
** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A MacHovec

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew A MacHovec in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Defendant makes statements.  Wayne MacHovec makes statements.  Attorney Kuhary requests expungement.  State takes no position.     The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

Count 1:

FINE: $914.50 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant has 60-days to pay the fine and costs in full by 3-5-18.  The alternate sentence is 22-days jail.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon payment of all costs and fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
